snippet: Consumers replaced worn-out models and analysts said they expected a modest upward trend again this year.
abstract: European Automobile Manufacturer's Assn reports that new passenger car registrations in the European Union rose 5.7 percent in 2014, indicating that Continent's auto market has grown for first time since before global financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: Consumers replaced worn-out models and analysts said they expected a modest upward trend again this year.

headline.print_headline: Car Market Shows Signs of Revival for Europe
headline.main: Car Market Shows Signs of Revival for Europe
